content: Looking at the Forum because of a spam comment. In admin/content/comment/spam I saw two comments which are not spam. They are published, so everything is fine for the moment, but I guess it's not ideal for future posts of the comment authors. How can the comments be removed from the mentioned listing, or how can they be tagged as 'no spam'?
My other question is about the policy regarding spam comments: Delete comment, I guess, but block or delete user account?
Oh, I don't seem to have user related permissions anyway. @klonos Can you add these for me as well, or have a look at the spam author's account peterjane?
@Olaf Grabienski I've made you a Developer.
I think for spam comments, I'll check what other comments/posts the user has made (typically there's only one, or they're all spam), in which case I'll delete the user and their content.
Thanks, @BWPanda! Where can I check if there are comments of the author? On accounts/SOME-NAME there seem to be only "Conversations started by". On admin/content/comment there are no filters.
Ah ok, that's all I do, sorry - just check their other conversations, not comments.
Ok, seems fine in this case! (Filter authors on admin/content/comment would however be helpful.)

This post here seems legit: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/headless-backdrop-setup ...but the link that the author provides points to what seems to be a test or abandoned Backdrop site, with many spam comments. The user has provided another legit comment on a forum post by Jen re feedback fro Backdrop 1.10.0:

Hi, i just installed Backdrop yesterday.

It' s is a piece of cake, for someone who is familiar with the Drupal Hooks and API.

Thanks a lot...

Robert

...my point is that the user seems to be legit, but the link they've provided may be harmful (not intentional on their end though) ...should I unpublish that post? ...should I edit to remove the link? ...or should we contact the user to let them know?
If you just comment that the site is broken the author may respond if he's subscribed. Its a discussion forum, let him/her discuss. :smile:
Good thinking @docwilmot ...done :+1:
Do we need better/different spam protection for the Forum...? Seems a lot has been getting through lately.
Do we know how much is getting blocked?
@BWPanda perhaps the spam block success rate is the same, but the activity (number of people/posts/comments) has increased? :shrug:
